text: The Bayer designation for stars uses Greek letters to assign names to stars. For example: *α Canis Majoris *θ Orionis *ζ Reticuli It usually starts with the letter alpha (α) assigned to the brightest star in the constellation, then going down the Greek alphabet to assign letters for other stars (beta, gamma, delta, etc.) in order of decreasing brightness (apparent magnitude). Category:Astronomical catalogues
title: Bayer designation
